Show / Hide Table of Contents

Namespace RobotComponents.Actions

Classes

AbsoluteJointMovement

Absolute Joint Movement class

Action

Action class, abstract main class for all actions.

AutoAxisConfig

Auto Axis Configuration Class, sets Auto Axis Configuration to True or False.

CodeLine

Code Line class, defines a CodeLine in RAPID Code.

Comment

Comment class, defines a Comment in RAPID Code. A comment is only used to make the program easier to understand. It has no effect on the execution of the program.

DigitalOutput

Digital Output class. Is used to change the value of a digital output signal.

ExternalJointPosition

External Joint Position class, defines external joint position data. Is used to define the axis positions of external axes, positioners and workpiece manipulators.

JointTarget

Joint Target class, defines each individual axis position, for both the robot and the external axes.

Movement

Movement class

OverrideRobotTool

Override Robot Tool class

RAPIDGenerator

RAPID Generator class, creates RAPID Code from Actions.

RobotJointPosition

Robot Joint Position class, defines the robot axis positions of the in degrees.

RobotTarget

Robot Target class, defines robot target data. The robt target data is used to define the position of the robot and external axes.

SpeedData

SpeedData class. SpeedData is used to specify the velocity at which both the robot and the external axes move. Speed data defines the velocity at which the tool center point moves, the reorientation speed of the tool, and at which linear or rotating external axes move. When several different types of movement are combined, one of the velocities often limits all movements.The velocity of the other movements will be reduced in such a way that all movements will finish executing at the same time.

WaitDI

Wait for Digital Input. This class is used to make the code line comamand WaitDI which is is used to wait until a digital input is set.

WaitTime

WaitTime class, defines waiting time between two actions. This command is used to wait a given amount of time.

ZoneData

ZoneData class. Zoned Data is used to specify how a position is to be terminated, i.e. how close to the programmed position the axes must be before moving towards the next position.

Interfaces

IJointPosition

Defines the interface for different joint position types

ITarget

A boolean that indicates if the Target object is valid.
